segments.text: The image of the cookies in that jar makes me feel a pang of jealousy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why is it that children always manage to find the things they’re not supposed to have?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the glimmer of mischief in the boy’s eyes as he reaches in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s anticipation is almost unbearable; I can't help but feel their excitement.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I feel a sense of anger at the thought of them being so secretive.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if they are testing the limits of their mother's oblivion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will this secret endeavor end in laughter or tears?
segments.speaker: PAR
